parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an obsolete primary of the same meaning; to show.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
From ano and ge; above the ground, i.e. the second floor of a building; used for a dome or a balcony on the upper story.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To spread, make a bed. Or simpler stronnuo, prolongation from a still simpler stroo, ; to 'strew, ' i.e. Spread.
Ready, prepared. From an old noun heteos; adjusted, i.e. Ready.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
